page.title: 13TRANSPORT
page.content: BATH : TRAFFIC PROBLEM. Bath is famous for its Georgian buildings and Roman remains but, probably not so well known for its traffic problem.The main problem is the city centre but it extends to our survey area which is bisected by principal roads where the majority of buildings were built. When these streets were originally planned no one dreamt that the flow and type of traffic would be what it is in 1985.In 1964 car ownership in Bath was 14,000 that is 170 people per car. In 1985 the figure is closer to 50 people per car.
